page.title: 11The DRG Factory. Kingswood.
page.content: The large red brick factory in Carsons Road, Mangotsfield was built in 1910 as a{Carson's Chocolate {factory.}In the 1960's it was taken over by the{Dickinson Robinson Group as one of their many factories in the Bristol area which make{paper {products.}At Mangotsfield they make and store paper on huge rollers, e.g. {cling film.}They have built a new factory building on the site which contains their offices and an air-sealed hygienic unit. The old and new factory buildings are connected via elevated tunnels. The special sealed unit produces{sterile {flex-packs}which are for use in hospitals. The product must be kept clean so, the unit has an entrance chamber where the workers change into {special overalls}to prevent the risk of contamination.
